moves.1. d4 Nf6: What can I say? I am a fan of my Indian systems.
moves.2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4: I particularly like the Nimzo-Indian Defense for Black. I have spent time studying over-the-board games for many years and Indian systems make for a more dynamic game for both sides.
moves.4. e3 c5: I believe this variation is known as the Hübner Variation, but I could be wrong. Someone pleas e confirm whether this is correct or not.
moves.5. Nf3 O-O: Quickly goes to the main line at this point.
moves.6. Bd3 d5 7. O-O cxd4 8. exd4 dxc4 9. Bx: Usually white's pawn structure is weakened at this point by doubling or tripling. Like I said though, this opening is quite interesting in where it leads.
I thought this was a weak response on my part but the board is completely even at this point...interesting.
moves.18. Bh4 Qc6: Applying pressure on g2, easily defended by several options.
moves.19. Rg3 Qd6: Trying to find a weakness in white's development, but this was difficult.
moves.20. Qg4: This is why I worried about my h6 move earlier. In case of this kind of attack, I don't have any protection for it after g6 until later in the game.
moves.20... g6: But nothing attacking it now so this is black's move of choice.
moves.21. Re1 Rfe8 22. Rge3 Qb4 23. Rd3 Rac8 2: ! - a solid response. This attacks the f-line pawn and the weakened h6 pawn. I considered several options here: 1) defending with the queen - Qf8, preventing further attacks on that line, but I think I lose tempo 2) g5?? - while this option may look appealing, after 24) ... g5 25) Bxg5! hxg5 26) Qxg5+! Kf8 27) Rh3 f6 28) Qg4 ... I'm not really liking this for black. The kingside is completely destroyed, which leaves me with a losing position. This leads to another option which I eventually chose...
moves.24... Kg7: The King protects both pawns and is defended enough to move here so I didn't feel as uncomfortable with it. I looked at every possible outcome that I could as my time was running low (2 min per move doesn't leave me much time to think) Of the 2 minutes, I used 1 min 58 seconds coming up with this response.
moves.25. Rh3: White continues to try to apply pressure to a weak pawn
moves.25... Reh8: But this is why I liked my King move best! a defender to the rescue!
moves.26. Rb3: Leading white to go try his luck elsewhere.
moves.26... Qa5 27. Qe3 Qh5: With all the attacks neutralized, figured this is a good time to attack. Though mine isn't as strong at the moment...
moves.28. Bg3 Qg5: I like games where I can make my opponent play without his queen. Though had white taken I probably would be at high risk for a drawish position, possibly losing later without it as I don't currently have any sort of attack for the kingside due to the weak side bishop defending that area pretty well.
Was my best option I thought. Pushing the pawn certainly doesn't help me.
moves.35. Bd6 a4: Defend by advancing! I love it.
moves.45. Bxe5: After this I offered a draw, to which my opponent decided no.
moves.45... g4 46. Qa2 h5 47. Rgc3 h4 48. Rb1: ! - An interesting position. Was thinking white would give up the rook and attack the weakened pawns.
moves.49... h3: going here I was thinking Rxa6 would follow then I'd go hxg2. Leading to Rg3 Rgf8 h3 Rf7 Rxc6 Rxc6 (the sacrifice I foresaw earlier).
moves.50. g3: Was quite surprised to see this, but seeing how the game was going, I guess I shouldn't be.
moves.50... a5 51. Kf2 Qe8 52. Bd6 Qd7 53. Rc1: ?! - I was looking at 2 decisions here. If White took with bishop, Qxd4+! Ke2 Bf3+ Kf1 Qe3 Rc2 Bg2+ Rxg2 Qc1+ Kf2 Qxc5+ giving me an edge in attacking. The other option isn't as strong, but leaves me up a pawn: Rxb8 Rxb8 d5 Bxd5! Qa1 Rg8 Qf6 Rg6 Qh4+ Rh6 Qe7+ Qxe7 Bxe7 and playing an endgame scenario from here.
moves.54. Be5: ? - would never have thought to see this move...interesting. Kind of ruins both plans now.
moves.54... Rb7 55. Ke3 Rc8 56. Kd2 Bd5 57. Qb: Here I got offered a draw, to which I declined.
Finally I have a good enough position where I have a plan!
moves.64. Kb1 Qe4+: First check of the game lol
moves.66. Rc2: Now he wants my queen lol
moves.66... Qd5: ...But I got other plans for it
moves.67. Rc1 Kf7 68. Qf2: ? - Interesting that he let me advance the pawn. I was thinking of sacrificing the queen, gaining a rook and retaking the queen later, but this seemed like a more feasible end game.
moves.69. Qe1: ?? - Wow a horrible blunder and I immediately recognized the mate in 4 from here. I know the pawn looks free but a horrible mistake in such a great game.
moves.69... Qg2 70. Qxe6+ Bxe6 71. Rc2 Qxc2 72: How unfortunate such a great game got ruined for 2 reasons: 1 - use of a computer program by my opponent (he admitted to me privately after our 2nd game) and 2 - this horrible, preventable mate. Must've turned the program off or something glitched in it lol
